idinfo.native: Microsoft Windows Vista Version 6.1 (Build 7600) ; ESRI ArcCatalog 9.3.1.4000

descript.abstract: United States Three -Digit ZIP Code Areas is a polygon theme representing the first three digits of a ZIP Code. The first digit of a five-digit ZIP Code divides the United States into 10 large groups of states numbered from 0 in the Northeast to 9 in the far West. Within these areas, each state is divided into an average of 10 smaller geographic areas, identified by the second and third digits. These digits, in conjunction with the first digit, represent a sectional center facility or a mail processing facility area. These areas are serviced by the U.S. Post Office Sectional Center Facility (SCF). Note that a single SCF often services multiple three-digit areas.
descript.purpose: United States Three -Digit ZIP Code Areas provides area and population for each three-digit ZIP Code area in the United States.
descript.supplinf: Largest scale when displaying the data: 1:50,000.

citeinfo.title: United States Three -Digit ZIP Code Areas, 2012

In the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing and consulting services to your local Esri Regional Office. For support, you may contact Esri Support Center by telephone (voice) between 5:00 a.m. and 5:00 p.m. Pacific time, Monday through Friday, by dialing 888-377-4575; facsimile (fax) available at 909-792-0960; electronic mail (e-mail) support@esri.com; or visit http://support.esri.com/; Esri holidays excluded.
Outside the United States– Please direct all inquiries regarding software/data pricing, sales, support, and consulting services to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/about-esri/locations.html.
For other questions or comments, you may contact Esri headquarters by e-mail, telephone, or fax or write to us.

metainfo.metstdn: FGDC Content Standards for Digital Geospatial Metadata

cntorgp.cntorg: Research Data Services (RDS), Columbia University Libraries

enttyp.enttypd: The polygons represent areas serviced by sectional center facilities or mail processing facilities within the United States.

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: The three-digit number used by the postal service to identify an area serviced by a sectional center facility or a mail processing facility.

codesetd.codesetn: USPS National 5-Digit ZIP Code® and Post Office Directory

attr.attrdef: The two-letter abbreviation for the state in which the ZIP Code area is located. A value of 'US' represent federal lands.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, National Institute of Standards and Technology

codesetd.codesets: National Institute of Standards and Technology

attr.attrdef: The 2010 population of the ZIP Code area.

attrdomv.udom: Populations for the features. A -99 value means no data.

attr.attrdef: The 2010 population of the ZIP Code area per square mile.
attr.attrdefs: Department of Commerce, Census Bureau; Esri

attrdomv.udom: Calculated populations per square mile for the features. A -99 value means no data.

attr.attrdef: The area of the ZIP Code polygon in square miles using Albers Equal Area Projection.

digtinfo.formspec: The SDC file contains the geospatial and attribute data. The SDI file contains the spatial index. The PRJ file contains the coordinate system information (optional). The XML file (*.sdc.xml) contains the metadata describing the data set (optional).

stdorder.ordering: Data & Maps is available only as part of Esri® software.

Outside the United States, please direct all inquiries to your local Esri Office. This information can be found at http://www.esri.com/about-esri/locations.html.

distinfo.techpreq: To use this data requires software that supports SDC files.

citeinfo.title: TomTom MultiNet Post; TomTom MultiNet Administrative Areas, 2012

srcinfo.srccitea: TomTom MultiNet Post v. 2011.06 and Administrative Areas v. 2011.12 and v. 2010.03

citeinfo.title: Summary File 1 (SF 1)
citeinfo.othercit: The Summary File 1 (SF 1) data is based on the 2010 Census of Population and Housing.

procstep.procdesc: The following steps were performed by Esri: Copied Data & Maps 2012 U.S. ZIP Code Areas (Five-Digit) and renamed it. Added the ZIP3 field and dissolved on the first three digits in the ZIP Code. Summarized the STATE and SQMI fields. Summarized the POP2010 field ignoring any "-99" records. Recalculated the POP10_SQMI field. For ZIP3 values of "000" and "001" calculated STATE = "US". Reformatted the fields. Converted the data set to SDC. Created ArcGIS® layer file (.lyr), projection file (.prj), and spatial indices.
procstep.srcused: TomTom MultiNet Post v. 2011.06 and Administrative Areas v. 2011.12 and v. 2010.03

horizpa.horizpar: Horizontal positional accuracy is dependent on geographic area. In most areas, accuracy is between 5 and 25 meters (16 and 82 feet). In some areas, accuracy is off by up to several tens of meters (100 feet or more). In the poorest areas, accuracy is off by up to 100 meters (328 feet).

dataqual.logic: The shapefile is converted to SDC (Smart Data Compression) format using tools in ArcGIS. The SDC data set is then imported into a file geodatabase to verify, validate, and if needed repair the geometry.
dataqual.complete: After processing, the data set is checked for drawing display and number of records and file sizes compared with source materials.
